meanings.sent1: He was caught assaulting the other team's player during the game.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for assaulting a stranger on the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept assaulting the toy mouse, thinking it was real.
meanings.sent4: The storm was assaulting the coastline with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was assaulting his opponent with powerful punches in the ring.

meanings.definition: Make a deliberate attempt to touch or sexually assault (someone) without their consent.
meanings.sent1: The predator was caught assaulting a young woman in the park.
meanings.sent2: It is unacceptable to assault someone by assaulting them without their permission.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler kept assaulting the cat with hugs and kisses.
meanings.sent4: The intrusive thoughts were assaulting her mind, making her feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The paparazzi were assaulting the celebrity with cameras and questions.

meanings.definition: Make a physical or verbal attack on.
meanings.sent1: The bully was constantly assaulting his classmates with hurtful words.
meanings.sent2: The protesters were peacefully marching when the police started assaulting them.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was assaulting the audience with jokes that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were assaulting her self-esteem, making her doubt her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The enemy troops were assaulting the castle walls with catapults and arrows.
